intro: Cyphocalyx poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar star orchid, is a rare and striking orchid native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers with a distinctive purple and white coloration. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in the humid and tropical climate of its native habitat. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by specific insect species, showcasing a specialized ecological relationship. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
